intro: Strobilanthes oresbia, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame-of-the-forest," is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests and is known for its ornamental value. Its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches, creating a dramatic visual display. Strobilanthes oresbia is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
